infodynamics.measures.continuous

Class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculatorCommon, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorGaussian, ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov

    public class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorViaCondMutualInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
    A Conditional Transfer Entropy (TE) calculator (implementing ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator) which is affected using a given Conditional Mutual Information (MI) calculator (implementing ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate) to make the calculations.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator, except that in the constructor(s) for this class the implementation for a ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate must be supplied.

    This class may be used directly, however users are advised that several child classes are available which already plug-in the various conditional MI estimators to provide conditional TE calculators (taking specific caution associated with each type of estimator):

    • ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorGaussian
    • ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Information modification and particle collisions in distributed computation" Chaos 20, 3, 037109 (2010).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier, email, www

      Array of embedding delays for the conditional variables.

      Array of embedding lengths for each conditional variable.

      Underlying conditional mutual information calculator

      Whether we are in debug mode

      The total dimensionality of our embedded conditional values (sum of condEmbedDims)

      Length of past destination history to consider (embedding length)

      Length of past source history to consider (embedding length)
      protected int l_tau
      Embedding delay to use between elements of the source embeding vector.
      protected int startTimeForFirstDestEmbedding
      Time index of the last point in the destination embedding of the first (destination past, source past, destination next) tuple that can be taken from any set of time-series observations.

    • Field Detail

      • condMiCalc

        protected ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate condMiCalc
        Underlying conditional mutual information calculator

      • k

        protected int k
        Length of past destination history to consider (embedding length)

      • k_tau

        protected int k_tau
        Embedding delay to use between elements of the destination embeding vector. We're hard-coding a delay of 1 between the history vector and the next observation however.

      • l

        protected int l
        Length of past source history to consider (embedding length)

      • l_tau

        protected int l_tau
        Embedding delay to use between elements of the source embeding vector.

      • delay

        protected int delay
        Source-destination next observation delay

      • condEmbedDims

        protected int[] condEmbedDims
        Array of embedding lengths for each conditional variable. Can be an empty array or null if there are no conditional variables.

      • cond_taus

        protected int[] cond_taus
        Array of embedding delays for the conditional variables. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.

      • condDelays

        protected int[] condDelays
        Array of time lags between last element of each conditional variable and destination next value.

      • startTimeForFirstDestEmbedding

        protected int startTimeForFirstDestEmbedding
        Time index of the last point in the destination embedding of the first (destination past, source past, destination next) tuple that can be taken from any set of time-series observations.

      • dimOfConditionals

        protected int dimOfConditionals
        The total dimensionality of our embedded conditional values (sum of condEmbedDims)

      • debug

        protected boolean debug
        Whether we are in debug mode

        public void initialise(int k,
              int k_tau,
              int l,
              int l_tau,
              int delay,
              int condEmbedDim,
              int cond_tau,
              int condDelay)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Initialise the calculator with all required parameters for embeddings and delays supplied, for a single conditional variable. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Specified by:
        initialise in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        condEmbedDim - embedding lengths for one conditional variable. Can be 0 if there are no conditional variables.
        cond_tau - embedding delay for the conditional variable. Ignored if condEmbedDim == 0.
        condDelay - time lags between last element of the conditional variable and destination next value. Ignored if condEmbedDim == 0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialise

        public void initialise(int k,
              int k_tau,
              int l,
              int l_tau,
              int delay,
              int[] condEmbedDims,
              int[] cond_taus,
              int[] condDelays)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Initialise the calculator with all required parameters for embeddings and delays supplied. All other parameters remain unchanged.
        Specified by:
        initialise in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        k - Length of destination past history to consider
        k_tau - embedding delay for the destination variable
        l - length of source past history to consider
        l_tau - embedding delay for the source variable
        delay - time lag between last element of source and destination next value
        condEmbedDims - array of embedding lengths for each conditional variable. Can be an empty array or null if there are no conditional variables.
        cond_taus - array of embedding delays for the conditional variables. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        condDelays - array of time lags between last element of each conditional variable and destination next value. Must be same length as condEmbedDims array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for inconsistent arguments, e.g. if array lengths differ between condEmbedDims, cond_taus and condDelays.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets properties for the conditional TE calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • Any properties accepted by ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator;
        • Or properties accepted by the underlying InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.setProperty(String, String) implementation.

        Note: further properties may be defined by child classes.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem with the supplied value.

      • startAddObservations

        public void startAddObservations()
        Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorCommon
        Signal that we will add in the samples for computing the PDF from several disjoint time-series or trials via calls to "addObservations" rather than "setObservations" type methods (defined by the child interfaces and classes).
        Specified by:

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator

        Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • embedSourceDestAndConditionalsForCondMI

        protected double[][][] embedSourceDestAndConditionalsForCondMI(double[] source,
                                                   double[] destination,
                                                   double[][] conditionals)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Internal method to take (pre-screened) time-series for a source, destination and conditional variables, and embed them using the given embedding parameters, as well as combining the destination past and conditionals, making all ready for a conditional MI calculation.
        Parameters:
        source - source time-series observations
        destination - destination time-series observations. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D array of conditional time series observations (first index is time, second is variable number) Length must match source.
        Returns:
        double[][][] returnValue: where returnValue[0] is the embedded source vectors, returnValue[1] is the destination next values, and returnValue[2] is the joined embedded destination past and conditionals. The first index of each of these is (shifted) time, the second is embedding variable number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals,
                   int startTime,
                   int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        startTime - first time index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[] conditionals,
                   int startTime,
                   int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator

        Adds a new sub-series of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

        Important: this does not append/concatenate these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently.

        Note that the arrays source, destination and conditionals must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

        Specified by:
        addObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 1D time-series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        startTime - first time index to take observations on
        numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
        Throws:

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(double[] source,
                   double[] destination,
                   double[][] conditionals,
                   boolean[] sourceValid,
                   boolean[] destValid,
                   boolean[][] conditionalsValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator

        Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from, but only where these observations are indicated to be valid. Cannot be called in conjunction with ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[]) / ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations().

        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        source - time-series observations for the source variable
        destination - time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        conditionals - 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        sourceValid - time-series (with time indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that point is valid.
        destValid - time-series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that point is valid.
        conditionalsValid - 2D time-series (with time indices the same as conditionals) indicating whether the conditional variables at that point are valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeStartAndEndTimePairs

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the time series of local conditional TE values for the previously supplied observations.

        Computes the local values of the implemented channel measure, for each valid observation in the previously supplied observations (with PDFs computed using all of the previously supplied observation sets).

        If the samples were supplied via a single call such as #setObservations(double[]), then the return value is a single time-series of local channel measure values corresponding to these samples.

        Otherwise where disjoint time-series observations were supplied using several calls such as addObservations(double[]) then the local values for each disjoint observation set will be appended here to create a single "time-series" return array.

        Specified by:
        computeLocalOfPreviousObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorCommon
        Returns:
        a time-series array of local TE values of the previously submitted observations. If only a single series was submitted, then the first startTimeForFirstDestEmbedding steps are filled with zeros (since local conditional TE is undefined here)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[] newSourceObservations,
                                             double[] newDestObservations,
                                             double[][] newCondObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Compute local conditional transfer entropy values for the observations in the given time-series, using the PDFs computed from the previously supplied method calls.
        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - new time-series observations for the source variable
        newDestObservations - new time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        newCondObservations - new 2D time-series array for the conditional variables (first index is time, second index is variable number). Length must match source.
        Returns:
        the time-series of local conditional TE values. First values will be set to zero until enough samples are accumulated to embed the variables as per the parameter settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[] newSourceObservations,
                                             double[] newDestObservations,
                                             double[] newCondObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Compute local conditional transfer entropy values for the observations in the given parameters, using the PDFs computed from the previously supplied method calls.
        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        newSourceObservations - new time-series observations for the source variable
        newDestObservations - new time-series of observations for the destination variable. Length must match source.
        newCondObservations - new 1D time-series array for the conditional variables (indexed by time only) -- valid only if the calculator was initialised for a single conditional variable. Length must match source.
        Returns:
        the time-series of local conditional TE values. First values will be set to zero until enough samples are accumulated to embed the variables as per the parameter settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for example if the calculator was not initialised for a single conditional variable

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
        Generate an empirical (bootstrapped) distribution of what the given measure would look like, under a null hypothesis that the source values of our samples had no relation to the destination value (possibly in the context of a conditional value).

        See Section II.E "Statistical significance testing" of the JIDT paper below for a description of how this is done for MI, conditional MI and TE.

        Note that if several disjoint time-series have been added as observations using addObservations methods etc., then these separate "trials" will be mixed up in the generation of surrogates here.

        References:

        • J.T. Lizier, "JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems", 2014.
        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
        Parameters:
        numPermutationsToCheck - number of surrogate samples to bootstrap to generate the distribution.
        Returns:
        the empirical distribution of measure scores under this null hypothesis.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        "J.T. Lizier, 'JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems', 2014."

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
        Generate an empirical (bootstrapped) distribution of what the given measure would look like, under a null hypothesis that the source values of our samples had no relation to the destination value (possibly in the context of a conditional value).

        See Section II.E "Statistical significance testing" of the JIDT paper below for a description of how this is done MI, conditional MI and TE.

        Note that if several disjoint time-series have been added as observations using addObservations methods etc., then these separate "trials" will be mixed up in the generation of surrogates here.

        This method (in contrast to EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int)) allows the user to specify how to construct the surrogates, such that repeatable results may be obtained.

        References:

        • J.T. Lizier, "JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems", 2014.
        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
        Parameters:
        newOrderings - a specification of how to shuffle the next values to create the surrogates to generate the distribution with. The first index is the permutation number (i.e. newOrderings.length is the number of surrogate samples we use to bootstrap to generate the distribution here.) Each array newOrderings[i] should be an array of length N (where would be the value returned by a call to getNumObservations() for the given measure) containing a permutation of the values in 0..(N-1).
        Returns:
        the empirical distribution of measure scores under this null hypothesis.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - where e.g. the newOrderings don't supply arrays of the correct length matching the number of observations that we have.
        See Also:
        "J.T. Lizier, 'JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems', 2014."

      • getNumObservations

        public int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Specified by:
        getNumObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
